result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Edward P. Alloway Jr was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Edward P. Alloway Jr was found guilty of Disorderly conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: On driver's licenese and any vehicles titled in his name commencing upon issuance of valid DL.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward P. Alloway Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Called at 10:36 AM. Also called 15CM19, 15TR61 and 15TR62. State - moves to dismiss both citations. Court dismisses both citations. State - resolved - have complied with victim notification requirements with no response - joint recommendation. Cveykus - on 15CM19 - plead G to count #4 as alleged - 45 days in FC jail, $1695 fine inclusive of costs, 24 months DL revocation, IID, 2 days credit; amend #1 to county ordiance of DC with a fine of $500 plus costs and all other counts DRI;  on 15CF32 - plead to counts #4 and #5 as alleged - joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 18 months with conditons of: absolute sobriety, AODA, anger management, no contact with victim, counseling as deemed appropriate by P&P, court costs on each count, employment/school. Alloway and State agree. Court - amends count #1 on 15CM19 to county ordinance of DC - pleads G - finds G - fine of $500.00 plus costs totalling $834.50 - take bond posted, court dismisses and reads in counts #2 and #3, Alloway pleads G to count #4 as allged. Court - 15CF32 - dismiss and read in counts #1, #2 and #3, Alloway pleads G to count #4 and #5 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - provides court with exhibits #1 and #2 (JOC and certified driving record of defendant) - final joint recommendation. Cveykus makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - asks for huber for child care on jail time and asks for time to report. Alloway withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 15CM19 - count #4 - 45 days in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - credit for 2 days - report immediately, fine of $1695.00 inclusive of costs - take bond posted and use remainder of bond on 15CF32 to pay in full, AODA, 24 month DL revocation, IID on DL and any vehicles for 2 years commencing upon issuance of valid DL; on 15CF32 - counts #4 and #5 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 months - concurrent to each other and to jail time, with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru if recommended by P&P, court costs (including DNA surcharge) - take bond posted and remainder ($165.50) due in 60 days/CO, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, obtain GED, 50 hours of community service total, no contact with victim, counseling as deemed appropriate by P&P, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, right to appeal, adjourned.

Defendant Edward P. Alloway in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:46 PM. Also called 15CM19, 15TR61 and 15TR62. Cveykus - not resolved. Court continues bond on all matters, sets both criminal matters for JT. If analyst is not available, then 15CF32 will be #1, otherwise 15CM19 is #1. Cveykus has explained Frye.  Jury trial scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Edward P. Alloway in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:31 PM. Also called 15CM19, 15TR62 and 15TR61. Recess to allow State time to talk to his witness (3:33 PM). Recalled at 3:35 P. State calls Vincent Bourdon. Bourdon sworn in at 3:35 PM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant. Cross exam by Cveykus at 3:43 PM. States objects - incorrect characterization - no ruling, re-asked (3:44 PM). State objects - relevance - overruled (3:49 PM). Re-direct by State at 3:50 PM. Court asks question of witness. Bourdon excused at 3:52 PM. Cveykus does not belief there is a basis for felony charges for stated reasons. State responds. Court finds that no felony was committed, dismisses count #3. Cveykus enters NG pleas on other counts and waives further reading of the complaint. Court continues bond on all matters and set all matters for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 02:45 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Edward P. Alloway in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus appears telephonically with leave of the Court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 8:56. Also called 15CM19, 15TR61 and 15TR62. Cveykus and Alloway have the complaints, waives reading for all of them, enters NG pleas on the CM case and requests PH on CF case, waiving time limits, enter NG please on traffic citations and track citations with criminal matters. Court sets 15CF32 for PH and 15CM19 for STC. Cveykus - bond forfeiture on 15CM19 case - argue against bond forfeiture. State - bond forfeiture - believe defendant had notice of hearing. Court - vacates bond forfeiture and bond has previously been set for $2500.00 that is already posted. Court continues bond at this point on all cases. State - would like to add a condition of no entry into any bars or taverns for stated reasons. Cveykus - no objections. Court amends both bonds to reflect no consumption of alcohol, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, no contact with any victims.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 03:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
No consumption of alcohol, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, no contact with any victims.

Defendant Edward P. Alloway in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:04 AM. Also called 15CF32 and 2015-2902. Alloway has complaints on 15CF32 and 15CM19. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Alloway understands charges and penalties, will hire his own attorney. Court sets all matters for AIA and must appear with an attorney. Court continues bond on this matter. On 15CM19 - wasn't aware when his court date was on this matter and that is why he missed court. Alloway does not remember if he received this complaint. Defendant handed complaint in court. Court reads charges and penalties. Alloway understands charges and penalties. Court sets this matter for AIA on same date and time. Court - bond - $2500.00 cash - set the bond forfeiture for same date and time. 2015-2902 - no complaint filed yet, vacates bond, return bond posted, State can still prosecute but released from bond at this point.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 08:45 am.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with any victims.

ADDRESS INFO for Edward P. Alloway Jr
Current: P.O. Box 111, Crandon, WI 54520 United States  (Effective: 02-23-2015)
Prior: 5536 Wejmogek Court, Crandon, WI 54520

Defendant Edward P. Alloway not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:22 a.m. State - S&C was mailed to defendant and no indication of being returned, asks for bond to be forfieted and warrant issued. Court - orders bond forfeited and issues bench warrant $1500.  Bail/Bond Review scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with any victims.
